intro: Nonea paniculata, commonly known as the clustered greenbottle bush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Nonea paniculata is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
